story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: underdog_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: This Solid race scored higher than Unbound on Length.
primary_trope.mechanism: Von Restorff effect — the outlier demands attention. Underdog arcs trigger prediction error (brain expected low, got high).

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Pony Xpress Gravel 160? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Pony Xpress Gravel 160 scored 54 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Pony Xpress Gravel 160?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Pony Xpress Gravel 160. Trinidad, CO. 160 mi. Colorado mountains ultra gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Pony Xpress Gravel 160 | Trinidad, CO | 160 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Length. 5 out of 5. Your legs will remember this one for weeks. Three aid stations at miles 25, 50, and 75 support the full 160K distance with proper fueling infrastructure. Elevation. 5 out of 5. Elevation gain that belongs on a trail run. 12,000 feet of gain over 160K puts this firmly in the hurt-locker category - that's 75 feet per kilometer of pure vertical punishment. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Bike handling matters here. Practice your descents. The course combines 96% gravel county roads with technical navigation challenges requiring GPS and handlebar-mounted maps. Adventure. 4 out of 5. The kind of ride you'll tell stories about. Riding through historic mining areas including the Ludlow Memorial adds historical context to the suffering. Altitude. 3 out of 5. Moderate altitude. Worth acclimatizing for. Trinidad sits around 6,000 feet with the course climbing into higher foothills, putting you in moderate altitude territory that affects sea-level dwellers but isn't devastating. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Trinidad offers affordable lodging options including Las Animas County fairgrounds camping at $25 per night with basic amenities. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Tony Huston traveled from Houston with zero acclimatization and "no real idea of what to expect," highlighting the minimal pre-race information available. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Community. 2 out of 5. Polite. Not exactly warm. Value. 2 out of 5. Value is not the strong suit. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Not exactly stacked.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: The case for Pony Xpress Gravel 160.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Trinidad has limited lodging. Plan ahead.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Colorado Ultra Gravel. If you're local to CO and chasing ultra challenges. yes. If you're traveling. skip it unless you're ultra-focused.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Pony Xpress Gravel 160 isn't quite right for you. For better CO ultra races: Check regional ultra options.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Pony Xpress Gravel 160? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.
